intro: Heteropterys campestris var. transiens, commonly known as the transiens heteropterys, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
